WRITING.TEXT: I got a bottle of this for my birthday last year, really good, really nice rum notes with just the right amount of peat
Really nice collection, what's your opinions on the Lagavulin 16 yr old? I think it's lovely
Is there actually a nebula in the game that bright and colourful or is that a filter, it looks amazing
Such a nice screenshot mate :)

Nice review mate, Talisker 15 (2019 special release) was my first bottle over #163;100, because my first ever scotch experience was with Talisker when I visited their distillery in Skye a few years ago, they've always had a special place in my heart, I love Talisker 15 mainly because I get a complete flavour explosion from it that not many whiskey's deliver for me, I know it can be more intense and potent being cask strength which makes them more stronger than other whiskey but that's something I've always been into

WRITING.TITLE: Best LTD mining spots near Colonia?
WRITING.TEXT: I'm in Colonia and I was wondering where the best overlapping LTD hotspots are near by?

WRITING.TITLE: Heat mat not heating plastic tank up enough
WRITING.TEXT: Hey, I very recently brought a Curly Haired Juvenile tarantula that is housed in a plastic terrarium in my room, I have a wall exterior mounted heat mat but my tarantula has been right on it all night, and the mat can't seem to get the air temperature in the terrarium over 20 #176;c and it's been on all this time, I'm worried about him, what should I do?

Wish I heard all that in the research I've done on tarantulas for beginners, I put the heat mat on the exterior wall just like the set up video for the set i brought, that was to creates a hot and a cool zone in the terrarium, it's not my house mate and I was never told that getting a tarantula involves wacking up the heating bill in my parents house, surley getting a thermostat for the heat mat would help maintain a safe temperature?
Would you suggest an alternative heat source?

Winter and when it's hot in the summer is when it's not an issue but British summers are sometimes cold and that's when I can't keep the heating on my my parents house, I could keep a mini camping heater on if it is cold but not during the night

If you're a big fan of Talisker I think you'll love it like I did, I got a full palate explosion of flavour for my taste buds that I don't get from many whiskey's, that's understandable, I think it's definitely worth the price but even for me I was thinking "Christ I hope it's worth it" as I've never spent that much money on a bottle before

Yeah Im not great with money so I probably shouldn't of brought it but in comparison to what some people spend on alcohol in one night that #163;112 lasts alot longer and is much more enjoyable, well in my opinion. ah nice, I love T10, my first bottle of Scotch and probably my favorite is Talisker storm with dark storm close after it, it's a 2019 special limited release I think mate

Yeah, your much more likely to remember it and it's lasts alot longer, that's fair, when it's my birthday I might have to get a bottle of similar price if there's one I really like and have tried before, nice I know alot of people pair cigars with whiskey, I don't personally smoke so it's never been my thing, I just adore the whole whiskey drinking experience
I don't think I've ever tried highland Park, it's on my list of Scotch distillery's I need to experience, yeah I'd love to hear how it affects it
If your interested I can show you my current whiskey collection if you want :)
That's sounds right up my street, I've only ever tried Oban 14 but I loved it

I like to mix my scotch into water like squash

Ah that's a shame, it's the go to place in the UK but I'm not sure what the equivalent is in the US
Talisker storm, first tried it at the distillery on the isle of skye
I'd love to hear your thoughts on the hibiki
Ah nice, the only Japanese whiskey I've tasted is Nikka Whiskey from a barrel, I would describe that as a after dinner dram aswell
Yeah it's definitely abit like Oban 14 but for me Talisker is very iconic in smell and taste, if I was blind tasting whiskeys I bet I could pick out the taliskers from other island malts
Holy crap, the most I've ever got for delivering 120 units of cargo was 6.7 mil

Ah nice, I've only tried the Sherry wood cask

Well it was very nice of you two to blast your unasked for opinions in my face, but I still think it's nice never said I was stating fact

WRITING.TITLE: Is it Normal for a curly haired tarantula to spend all it's time in it's burrow?
WRITING.TEXT: I've had my curly haired tarantula for a couple of months now and it's spent almost all that time digging and hiding in it's burrow, at first I thought it was because it was going to molt but even after it did i still haven't seen it out of it's burrow, I don't mind this but I didn't know they were a burrowing species and I am worried he hasn't touched his water bowl, i was also looking forward to observing him more in the open and on the rare occasion carefully handling him
I know humor differs from person to person and I'm not trying to be mean but where is the joke with this post?
Ah okay that makes sense as I brought him as a juvenile
A sports badge is completely different to a sticker in Japanese, are you okay in the head?
But still the posts this guy has made are all very bizarre
To be honest, I agree, it wasn't the right choice of words, and I regret saying that as I didn't mean it to be perceived that way.
Me?
Yeah I am ah that's fair, I just haven't seen odd and bizarre posts till I saw two of his, no offense to him
That was a beautiful explanation, I was honored to of read it

WRITING.TITLE: Has anyone tried Hudson bourbon? If so what are your thoughts on it?

WRITING.TEXT: Yeah I agree tbh, they are quite unique and for there price there probably better alternatives, what alternatives would you recommend for someone who's only really experience with bourbon is hudson haha?
My first Bunnahbian, it's really solid for it's price point, was good enough to make me a fan of the brand also one of my best smelling whiskeys too
I'll definitely give one of those a try, thanks
My Juvenile Curly hair is basically a pet hole, I think that changes the older they get though
Yeah same, I'm glad I can still watch mine through the terrarium side
Haha, thats so cool, mines cleared the entire side of the terrarium so I can everything he does

Mine keeps blocking himself in but I think it's too soon from his last molt to be molting again, even though Dima will always be my first tarantula, I'm getting a juvenile brazilian black aswell and maybe a GBB sling
I brought a Curly Haired tarantula a few months ago to overcome my quite bad Arachnophobia, it seriously helped and now I've brought two more tarantulas
